title: Bold Slab Serif in Webster’s Seventh
content:
The definition text is some small size of Times Roman, of course. Heading looks like Futura or some Futur-alike. What is the bold text font? Printed in 1967, composited by R.R. Donnelly in Chicago. This is Webster’s Seventh New Collegiate dictionary, which I grew up with as a child.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044852im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WebstersSeventh_6530.png)
author: johnbutler

comments.content: Possibly a version of Bookman or Clarendon.

No, I looked at those. The lowercase a precludes most Clarendons. And I can’t find any condensed Bookman.

I’m guessing it was composed on some kind of Monotype machine.
